mdRecord.dcterms:description: Passenger service ceased in 1971, and the Union Station was donated to the City of Omaha by the Union Pacific Railroad in 1973. That year the station quickly became the home of the Durham Museum, which is dedicated to preserving and displaying the history of the United States' western region. The Union Pacific Museum and Archives were also located there. Renovation, addition and new climate controls added 1997. — https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omaha_Union_Station [work]
